Alpet D2 Sanitizer is a highly evaporative, effective sanitizer that kills bacteria and other pathogens. Clean, sanitize and disinfect food contact and non-porous surfaces within your facility quickly and easily. Packaged in convenient quart bottles with trigger sprayers, as well as 5 gallon pails and 50 gallon drums, sanitizing food contact surfaces is made simple with Alpet D2 Surface Sanitizer Spray.

*   Ready-to-Use, no-rinse required
*   70% Alcohol Formula (62.5% ethanol / 7.5% isopropanol)
*   Highly Evaporative and ideal for low moisture environments and water sensitive equipment
*   60 Second Kill on food contact surfaces, including rubber gloves\

# Foaming Drain Cleaner Solutions for Industrial Applications

Foaming drain cleaners provide an effective solution for tackling tough clogs in industrial settings. Unlike traditional liquid drain cleaners, foam-based solutions cling to pipe walls, offering enhanced contact and cleaning power.

At D2 Sanitizers, we offer a range of foam drain cleaning products designed for industrial applications. Formulated with powerful enzymes and surfactants, our products break down grease, organic matter and other stubborn build-ups. These products also act as an odor eliminator, effectively reducing unpleasant smells caused by organic material build-up in industrial drains. Regular use of foaming drain cleaners can help prevent future clogs and maintain optimal drain flow in industrial facilities.

# Online HACCP Certification: Achieve Your Goals Today

## Introduction to HACCP

In today’s food industry, ensuring safety and quality is paramount. The **Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)** system is a globally recognized framework designed to identify and control biological, chemical, and physical hazards throughout the food production process. From raw material sourcing to final product consumption, HACCP ensures food safety at every step.

This section will explain the importance of HACCP and how individuals can benefit from certification and training.

The _International HACCP Alliance_ offers accredited training and certification for individuals and companies looking to master food safety protocols. With the rise of **online HACCP training courses**, participants can access course materials, resources, and certificates conveniently after registration or course completion. # Peracetic Acid Suppliers: D2 Sanitizers

D2 Sanitizers is a regional supplier of specialty chemicals for industrial cleaning, including [**peracetic acid (PAA)**](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/product/alpet-paa-5-6-antimicrobial-solution).

Peracetic acid, also known as peroxyacetic acid, is a mixture of hydrogen peroxide and acetic acid in an equilibrium solution. PAA is scalable and has unique environmental benefits, which makes it an excellent cost effective disinfectant, sterilizer and water treatment for commercial food processing facilities.

# Floor Sanitizers for Food Service

## Selecting the Right Floor Sanitizer for Your Business

Choosing the right floor sanitizer for your restaurant is essential, as it directly impacts cleanliness and sanitation efficiency. Sanitizers are available in both liquid and solid forms, each offering unique application methods and levels of effectiveness. With numerous options on the market, it’s important to carefully consider the specific needs of your space to select the most suitable solution.

Start by assessing the types of flooring in your space, followed by the daily foot traffic volume. Consider any specific challenges, such as grease buildup or stubborn stains. Understanding these factors will help you choose a sanitizer that best meets your needs.

# Advanced Chemical Dispenser System | D2 Sanitizers

## Types of Chemical Dispensers

Different types of dispensers meet different needs in a food service area. Types of dispensers include touchless hand sanitizer dispensers, automatic soap dispensers, sink dispensers and foam soap dispensers.

### Touchless Hand Sanitizer Dispenser

Touchless hand sanitizer dispensers are now very popular, especially in places like restaurants. These dispensers help stop germs from spreading. They use special sensors to notice when hands are near and give out the right amount of sanitizer automatically.

Benefits of touchless hand sanitizer dispensers include:

*   **Reduced Cross-Contamination:** You don’t have to touch the dispenser, which helps keep germs away.
*   **Enhanced Hygiene:** They encourage everyone to clean their hands regularly.
*   **Cost-Effective:** These dispensers give out just the right amount of sanitizer. This cuts down on waste and saves money.

# Erin Flowers | D2 Sanitizers

Erin is our in-house wordsmith. She writes and edits website copy for search engine optimization, proofreads marketing materials and ensures brand consistency at the highest level for Southland Organics. The most detail-oriented of the team, we can rely on Erin to always cross our t’s and dot our i's!

Erin graduated from the [University of Georgia](https://www.uga.edu/) with a bachelor's degree in advertising. She lives in Columbus, Georgia with her husband, John, and their cat, Piper. In her free time, Erin loves to try new coffee shops and restaurants, spend time with her family and search for great finds in antique stores. She loves to stay sharp by reading (especially on the beach!), practicing calligraphy and playing a good game of backgammon.

# About D2 Sanitizers

At D2 Sanitizers, we believe in the power of clean—not just clean surfaces but clean practices, clean ingredients and clean impact. As the sister company to [**Southland Organics**](https://www.southlandorganics.com/collections/sanitizers), we bring the same passion for sustainability and purposeful innovation that has defined our work in agriculture to the world of sanitizers, disinfectants and soaps.  

## **COVID-19 Strikes**  

In January of 2020, before the full force of COVID-19 swept across the globe, we became a distributor, recognizing early on the critical role sanitation would play in the months ahead. Long before the hysteria hit, we understood that safeguarding industries like agriculture and food processing would be essential to maintaining the health and security of our communities.

# You Can Prevent Foodborne Illness by Sanitizing Your Kitchen Properly

Your kitchen is the heart of your home, and keeping your house safe and clean is imperative to your family's health. This is especially important during the holiday seasons, when guests are constantly coming and going.

For many, a kitchen is centered around delicious home-cooked meals and spending time with relatives. While making your home look and feel clean is important, you can’t forget about sanitizing and disinfecting where the real magic happens—your kitchen.  

## What is foodborne illness?

According to the [Center for Disease Control](https://www.cdc.gov/foodsafety/prevention.html) (CDC), foodborne illness is a harmful bacteria infection experienced after "swallowing food that has been contaminated with a variety of germs and toxic substances." Nearly 48 million people get sick each year from consuming contaminated meat, poultry and other food.

In the realm of sanitation and hygiene, particularly in industries such as food processing and commercial kitchen operations, understanding the science behind surface sanitizing is crucial. The efficacy of surface sanitizers, like [**Alpet D2**](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/product/alpet-d2-surface-sanitizer), is not solely dependent on their chemical composition but also on the length of time they are applied to surfaces.

The 60-second rule associated with Alpet D2 is a scientifically-backed guideline that ensures maximum germ elimination, crucial for maintaining industry-specific hygiene standards. This precision in application time is essential for facility managers, janitorial staff and food processing professionals to ensure a safe and sanitized environment.

# In-Depth Guide To Commercial Disinfectants

In the wake of global health challenges, the importance of maintaining a clean and sanitized environment has surged dramatically. Commercial disinfectants have emerged as essential tools in various settings, from hospitals and schools to offices and restaurants.

Commercial disinfectants can be classified into several categories based on their chemical composition and intended use. Here are some of the most common types:

### **Alcohol-Based Disinfectants**

Alcohol-based disinfectants typically contain isopropyl alcohol or ethanol as the active ingredient. They are effective against a broad spectrum of pathogens, including bacteria and viruses, making them suitable for quick disinfection. Common applications include hand sanitizers and surface cleaning in high-traffic areas.

Food safety is more critical than ever, and food businesses must uphold high sanitation standards. Peracetic acid is a strong oxidizing agent effective at eliminating germs. Typically a colorless liquid with a sharp, vinegar-like odor, it provides robust disinfection for various applications.

Hand sanitizers are liquid or gel-like products designed to reduce the number of microorganisms on the skin, particularly on the hands. # Shoe Sanitizer & Boot Sanitizing Stations for Food Service

## Understanding Shoe Sanitation in Food Service

Footwear can introduce dirt, germs and harmful bacteria into food-handling areas, often carrying contaminants from soil, water or animal waste. Without effective shoe sanitation, these microbes can transfer to food contact surfaces and pose serious safety risks.

Our footwear sanitizing systems provide a fast and efficient solution, significantly reducing the presence of harmful organisms and helping food service businesses enhance their safety standards.

## Benefits of Sanitizing Stations

### Enhancing Food Safety and Reducing Cross-Contamination Risks

# Frequently Asked Questions

Get answers to all of your sanitizing questions! Don't see one listed? Ask us [**here**](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/contact).

How do I clean and maintain the Foam Unit?

Regular maintenance ensures your Foam Unit stays in excellent working condition. Here are the steps to clean and maintain it:

• **Flush the system**: After each use, run clean water through the unit to flush out any remaining cleaning solution.

• **Inspect components**: Check hoses, fittings, and nozzles for wear or damage. Replace any worn parts as needed.

• **Clean the tank**: Periodically clean the tank with mild soap and water to remove residue and prevent buildup.

• **Charge the battery**: Fully charge the lithium-ion battery after each use to ensure it’s ready for the next session.

• **Store properly**: Keep the unit in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight or extreme temperatures.

Can I use any cleaning solution with the Foam Unit?

Yes, our Foam Units are compatible

D2 Sanitizers focuses on keeping food safe. Our products follow strict industry rules and are safe to use on food contact surfaces, as long as you use them correctly. They are also highly effective in eliminating human coronavirus quickly and efficiently on food-contact surfaces, ensuring a safe dining environment. There are precautionary statements on the packaging to help guide you, just like with hand soaps or cleaners.

headings: How do I clean and maintain the Foam Unit?
static.markdown_preview:
# How do I clean and maintain the Foam Unit?

Regular maintenance ensures your Foam Unit stays in excellent working condition. Here are the steps to clean and maintain it:

• **Flush the system**: After each use, run clean water through the unit to flush out any remaining cleaning solution.

• **Inspect components**: Check hoses, fittings, and nozzles for wear or damage. Replace any worn parts as needed.

• **Clean the tank**: Periodically clean the tank with mild soap and water to remove residue and prevent buildup.

• **Charge the battery**: Fully charge the lithium-ion battery after each use to ensure it’s ready for the next session.

• **Store properly**: Keep the unit in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight or extreme temperatures.

static.title: What are commercial disinfectants?
static.description: Sanitizer FAQ: Find Out What are commercial disinfectants?
static.markdown_preview:
# What are commercial disinfectants?

Commercial disinfectants are specialized chemical formulations designed to eliminate harmful microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses and fungi, from various surfaces in commercial settings. These products are essential for maintaining hygiene and preventing the spread of infectious diseases, particularly in high-traffic environments such as hospitals, schools, restaurants and offices.

The effectiveness of commercial disinfectants stems from their active ingredients, which often include compounds such as chlorine, hydrogen peroxide and quaternary ammonium compounds. Each of these ingredients works through distinct mechanisms to disrupt the structural integrity of microbial cells. For example, chlorine-based disinfectants can effectively oxidize cellular components, while quaternary ammonium compounds disrupt cell membranes, rendering the microorganisms inactive and unable to reproduce.

# What is the benzalkonium chloride (BAC) formula?

Benzalkonium chloride (BAC) is an active ingredient in household cleaners, hand sanitizers and many liquid soaps, including disinfectant soaps. As an antimicrobial agent, the BAC formula disrupts the functionality of many pathogens such as bacteria, viruses and fungi. Since it's highly effective at killing germs on the surface, many hand soaps and hand sanitizers use a BAC formula as one of many antimicrobial agents for their cleaning solutions.

Since it's highly effective at killing germs on the surface, many hand soaps and hand sanitizers use a BAC formula as one of many antimicrobial agents for their cleaning solutions.

static.description: Sanitizer FAQ: Find Out What does HACCP stand for?
static.markdown_preview:
# What does HACCP stand for?

HACCP stands for Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points. It is an approach for measuring the safety of products, procedures and prevention inside food production facilities and health care settings. The goal for HACCP is to protect food from spreading illness, like foodborne illness, and assuring that the food is safe and will not harm consumers.

When a product label displays "HACCP," it means that the product is designed to prevent foodborne illness in food production.

Industrial hand soap is a specially formulated soap designed for use in industrial settings or other environments that require heavy-duty cleaning. It is specifically engineered to remove tough stains, grease, heavy dirt, oil and other stubborn contaminants from the hands. Industrial hand soaps are typically more powerful and effective than regular soaps, making them ideal for industries such as food manufacturing, construction, automotive and healthcare. Surfaces in food processing areas can get contaminated by bacteria like _Salmonella_ and norovirus, so it is important to clean and sanitize them often with a foodservice surface sanitizer spray. Sanitize whenever there is a chance of contamination and at least every four hours. Use the right amount, which is usually a few fluid ounces per gallon of water, and rinse if needed. # Which hand soap kills the most germs?

When it comes to killing germs, one of the most effective hand soaps is antibacterial soap. Antibacterial hand soaps contain active ingredients, such as triclosan or benzalkonium chloride, which have been proven to eliminate a wide range of harmful microorganisms. These soaps work by disrupting the cell membranes of bacteria, viruses and other germs, effectively killing them on contact. However, it's important to note that regular handwashing with any soap, even non-antibacterial ones, can still help reduce the spread of germs and maintain good hand hygiene. Ultimately, the choice of hand soap depends on personal preference and individual needs. It is always advisable to choose a soap that is effective in killing germs while also being gentle on the skin. Following proper handwashing techniques, such as lathering for at least 20 seconds and thoroughly rinsing, are essential for overall effectiveness in reducing the spread of germs.

# What floor cleaner is used in the food industry?

In the food industry, the choice of floor cleaner is crucial, as it must effectively sanitize surfaces without posing a risk to food safety. Generally, floor sanitizers used in food service environments fall into two main categories: [**quaternary ammonium compounds (quats)**](https://www.d2sanitizers.com/product/alpet-no-rinse-quat-sanitizer) and chlorine-based sanitizers.

**1\. Quaternary Ammonium Compounds (Quats)**

Quats are widely used in the food service industry due to their effectiveness against bacteria, viruses and fungi. They are favored for their low toxicity and non-corrosive properties, making them safe for use around food. Popular quats include benzalkonium chloride and dodecylbenzenesulfonic acid. These sanitizers work effectively at both low and high temperatures, can be used as both a cleaner and a sanitizing agent and typically require a dwell time of only a few minutes to achieve maximum effectiveness.

static.title: How do quats work?
static.description: Sanitizer FAQ: Find Out How do quats work?
static.markdown_preview:
# How do quats work?

A quat's positive charge actually helps it bind to bacteria, viruses and other microorganisms that cause disease—all of which have a negative charge. By doing this, the germ's cell walls are disrupted, which ultimately leads to its destruction. To completely disinfect or sanitize a surface, quats must be in contact with that surface for a certain length of time. This time varies depending on the product and application method, so always double check the instructions on labels.

static.markdown_preview:
# Is foaming hand soap better than liquid soap?

Both types of soaps protect human skin from dirt and germ buildup on the surface of hands. Typical foam soap tends to be slightly less effective because the soap components pump out less frequently. However since Alpet E2 is an antibacterial sanitizing soap, it does not have much of a difference in comparison to liquid soap. Foam soaps are more cost-effective and environment friendly than liquid soaps.

static.title: What steps should I take if this product gets in my mouth or eyes?
static.description: Sanitizer FAQ: Find Out What steps should I take if this product gets in my mouth or eyes?
headings: What steps should I take if this product gets in my mouth or eyes?
static.markdown_preview:
# What steps should I take if this product gets in my mouth or eyes?

Contact to sensitive parts of the body may result in a stinging feeling or slight irritation. This irritation is treatable. If contact has been made with the eyes, gently rinse eyes with water as soon as possible. It may take 15 to 20 minutes to recover. If inhaled or swallowed, get some fresh air and breathe slowly.

If conditions still persist, call your doctor for medical attention.

static.markdown_preview:
# What is the difference between Alpet® E3 and Alpet® E3 Plus Hand Sanitizers?

The Alpet® E3 hand sanitizer is made up of isopropanol instead of ethanol. Due to the consistency of isopropanol, it has less efficacy than Alpet® E3 Plus. This means it does not prevent the _maximum_ spread of germs. Alpet® E3 Plus is recommended specifically for food and hospitality industries since it has been tested to kill 26 pathogens, alleviating most common germs.

headings: What is a quat-free surface cleaner and sanitizer?
static.markdown_preview:
# What is a quat-free surface cleaner and sanitizer?

A quat-free sanitizer is made up of alcohol components instead of the alternative solution that includes quaternary ammonium chloride. The main difference between a quat spray and quat-free solution is the residue left behind.

After Alpet D2 Quat-Free Surface Sanitizer Spray is sprayed upon a surface, the solution will evaporate quickly. A quat-free sanitization product will not leave unsightly residue on the surface.

static.title: What is sodium hydroxide, and why is it used in soap making?
static.description: Sanitizer FAQ: Find Out What is sodium hydroxide, and why is it used in soap making?
headings: What is sodium hydroxide, and why is it used in soap making?
static.markdown_preview:
# What is sodium hydroxide, and why is it used in soap making?

Sodium hydroxide, also known as lye, is a strong base commonly used in the soap industry. It plays a key role in the saponification process, where fats and oils are converted into soap. Sodium hydroxide is essential for creating solid soap bars and has a broad range of applications in other industries as well.

# Antibacterial soap vs. plain soap: Which is better?

The effectiveness of a soap depends on its purpose and capability to remove dirt and grime when washing the body and hands. Antibacterial soaps contain an ingredient called Triclosan, which protects from infections, disinfects and keep hands clean. This ingredient makes antibacterial products superior for preventing illness and killing germs on hands. However, according to the FDA, there has not been enough research to conclude that antibacterial soaps are safer than plain soaps.
